main.name: Nathan Phennel
main.bio: To pun it lightly, I'm a jack of all trades and a master of test. I have 4 years experience as a Web Developer and 3 years as a Test Engineer. I specialize in front-end work but can comfortably leverage the power of Node.js, React, Google Cloud Platform and CI/CD setup. I'm looking for a web developer position at a company which will utilize my excellent team management and communication skills.
main.bio2: In my free time, when not looking at code, I'm making music.
main.contactmessage: Use this handy lil form and I'll receive your message.

resume.skillmessage: In software, I have a skill-set developed from both professional and personal ventures.

work.title: Software Developer / Test Engineer
work.description: Developed an analytics product used internationally by Bank staff which leverages behavioral data to aid decision making. We use continuous testing (CI) to protect against regressions. I also work the product development which is a TS, React, Redux, Java stack hosted on GCP. For the wider company, I developed a unified framework for writing unit/integration/e2e tests to better align testers and devs.

work.title: Test Engineer
work.description: Web and API test automation running in CI to ensure our public site was always working as expected for our millions of users. To improve performance and security, I used Node.js and frameworks such as Nightwatch, Cypress, Puppet, Protractor and Web service tools like Postman/Newman, Rest-Assured, JMeter, Gatling. I integrated tests/bots into CI pipeline tools Jenkins, CircleCI, GitHub to build continuous testing tools.

work.title: Test Engineer
work.description: I oversaw the design, execution and maintenance of manual and automated tests for analytics product to support Woolworth's suppliers. Used Protractor, C#, and F# frameworks combined with local builds from feature branches to test breaking changes. I provided a robust communication channel between developers and QA which were dispersed globally.

education.description: Maintained a High Distinction Average throughout my degree. Focus included software development, design, implementation and maintenance. As part of my final research around IoT use in emergencies, my work was published in a scholarly journal:

I minored in Spanish. In the end, I graduated Cum Laude and maintained the Dean's list. Study programs abroad included Summer Semester in Mexico for Spanish immersion and Winter Semester in India for Ethnomusicology. To finish, I spearheaded a program to send teachers to Korea. There was even an article about my mission:

testimonials.text: He operates with a long-term strategic view and a day-to-day sense of urgency. Not someone who sits back on his heels and waits for things to happen ... he sees the need and makes it happen now.
I definitely recommend Nathan as he is a great agile tester with a strong appetite to learn. He is broad-minded and thinks outside of the box.
A high-achiever who is capable of digesting any new advanced technical knowledge you present at him. A studious individual who will go the extra miles/hours.
Nathan always aims to work towards achieving growth for the entire team, accomplishing goals, devising plans to achieve best results.
